content: @Aman Arora remind me what time of day works best for you?
I'm looking over my calendar and it's kind of ridiculous right now

Monday: End by noon
Rest: End by 12:30/1:00pm
If it's difficult we can keep this spot -- I can leave questions/status updates and we can go async from there
@Aman Arora I think I could do 2020-09-24T12:00:00-04:00
not this week actually :)
but most weeks
if that works
otherwise, probably has to be Friday, but i'd prefer to avoid that
That should fine yeah
actually I guess Monday could be ok too
^ Thursday
but Thu is probably my preferred time
btw PR is up for closure printing, proposal still needs approval from @Esteban KÃ¼ber , I'll ping them again today
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/77069
OK I adjusted the calendar invite, but I marked myself as "No" next week
I guess we could just delete the event next week instead

nikomatsakis said:

not this week actually :smile:

Wait are you available this week/are we doing a meeting tomorrow? It's fine if you're not available -- just making sure I'm on zulip if there is a meeting. There is an event for tomorrow in my calendar
FYI i think the meetings have reverted to old time on my calendar
hmm you're correct
also, @Aman Arora, would you like to do 1hr zoom meetings?
I was thinking that maybe it'd be useful to be a bit more involved, e.g., able to review code more directly
That could work
gimme a min
I adjusted the timing to 1hr anywy

Do we want to start pushing some of the newer analysis code for review, in case the bridge is masking something? Maybe to another branch, since old analysis is working fine (unit tests pass) we can add a -Zclosure-capture-analysis flag with

old: current behaviour (Default)
new: current behaviour but using new analysis (kind of broken, until tuple inference is done)
minimal: current behaviour but using new + minimal analysis

Benefit of something like this would be we can keep adding tests that print out the capture information and we can compare as changes go.

• Basically this weeked we'd hopefully start to experiment with minimal capture. Essentially not removing the bridge just yet. I think it would be better to do to this before we go refactor every part of the code that replaces closure_captures with the data-structure for the intermediate non-minimal one (while having to make it appear like old analysis.)
Pushing the newer code to where for review?

I was thinking dedicate a branch on our fork to keep getting reviews for the bridge, though this was mostly because I thought tuple inference would take a bit more longer. We were able to make fair amount of progress over the weekend, I'll post an update on the specific thread
Also are we doing a meeting this Thursday? I remember you mentioning you weren't available, I see you marked as going for the cal event

Aman Arora said:

Also are we doing a meeting this Thursday? I remember you mentioning you weren't available, I see you marked as going for the cal event

I am available this week
